snippet: Washington has called for the release of Kenneth Bae, who was sentenced to 15 years for committing what North Korea called “hostile acts.”
abstract: North Korea says that it will not use imprisoned American citizen Kenneth Bae, who was sentenced to 15 years hard labor for committing hostile acts against the state, as political leverage; country's refusal to release him, rejecting possibility of allowing any prominent American to visit and request his release, adds new source of tension in relationship with United States.
lead_paragraph: Washington has called for the release of Kenneth Bae, who was sentenced to 15 years for committing what North Korea called “hostile acts.”

headline.seo: Kenneth Bae Is No ‘Bargaining Chip,’ North Korea Says
headline.main: North Korea Says Prisoner Won’t Be Used as Leverage
headline.print_headline: North Korea Says Prisoner Won’t Be Used As Leverage
